org.spongepowered.api.world.extent

Interface BlockVolume

  • All Known Subinterfaces:
    ArchetypeVolume, Chunk, Extent, ImmutableBlockVolume, InteractableVolume, MutableBlockVolume, Schematic, TileEntityVolume, UnmodifiableBlockVolume, World

    public interface BlockVolume
    A volume containing blocks that can be at least accessed.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods Default Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      boolean containsBlock(int x, int y, int z)
      Returns true if the block volume contains a block at the specified position.
      default boolean containsBlock(com.flowpowered.math.vector.Vector3i position)
      Returns true if the block volume contains a block at the specified position.
      BlockState getBlock(int x, int y, int z)
      Gets a representation of the block at the given position.
      default BlockState getBlock(com.flowpowered.math.vector.Vector3i position)
      Gets a representation of the block at the given position.
      default MutableBlockVolume getBlockCopy()
      Returns a mutable copy of the blocks stored in this volume.
      MutableBlockVolume getBlockCopy(StorageType type)
      Returns a mutable copy of the blocks stored in this volume.
      com.flowpowered.math.vector.Vector3i getBlockMax()
      Gets the block location with the highest x, y and z that is still a valid position for getBlock(Vector3i).
      com.flowpowered.math.vector.Vector3i getBlockMin()
      Gets the block location with the lowest x, y and z that is still a valid position for getBlock(Vector3i).
      com.flowpowered.math.vector.Vector3i getBlockSize()
      Gets the size of the whole volume.
      BlockType getBlockType(int x, int y, int z)
      Gets the base type of block.
      default BlockType getBlockType(com.flowpowered.math.vector.Vector3i position)
      Gets the base type of block.
      BlockVolume getBlockView(DiscreteTransform3 transform)
      Returns a new volume that is viewed through some transformation.
      BlockVolume getBlockView(com.flowpowered.math.vector.Vector3i newMin, com.flowpowered.math.vector.Vector3i newMax)
      Returns a new volume that is the same or smaller than the current volume.
      BlockVolumeWorker<? extends BlockVolume> getBlockWorker()
      Gets a new block worker for this block volume.
      ImmutableBlockVolume getImmutableBlockCopy()
      Returns an immutable copy of the blocks stored in this volume.
      default BlockVolume getRelativeBlockView()
      Returns a new volume that is translated so that getBlockMin() returns Vector3i.ZERO.
      UnmodifiableBlockVolume getUnmodifiableBlockView()
      Returns a new volume that cannot be modified through this view.

    • Method Detail

      • getBlockMin

        com.flowpowered.math.vector.Vector3i getBlockMin()
        Gets the block location with the lowest x, y and z that is still a valid position for getBlock(Vector3i).
        Returns:
        The lowest block location

      • getBlockMax

        com.flowpowered.math.vector.Vector3i getBlockMax()
        Gets the block location with the highest x, y and z that is still a valid position for getBlock(Vector3i).
        Returns:
        The highest block location

      • getBlockSize

        com.flowpowered.math.vector.Vector3i getBlockSize()
        Gets the size of the whole volume. Defined as getBlockMax() - getBlockMin() + (1, 1, 1) .
        Returns:
        The size

      • containsBlock

        default boolean containsBlock(com.flowpowered.math.vector.Vector3i position)
        Returns true if the block volume contains a block at the specified position. This is defined as {getBlockMin() <= position <= getBlockMax()
        Parameters:
        position - The position to check
        Returns:
        Whether or not the position has a block in this volume

      • containsBlock

        boolean containsBlock(int x,
                      int y,
                      int z)
        Returns true if the block volume contains a block at the specified position. This is defined as {getBlockMin() <= (x, y, z) <= getBlockMax()
        Parameters:
        x - The X coordinate to check
        y - The Y coordinate to check
        z - The Z coordinate to check
        Returns:
        Whether or not the position has a block in this volume

      • getBlock

        default BlockState getBlock(com.flowpowered.math.vector.Vector3i position)
        Gets a representation of the block at the given position.
        Parameters:
        position - The position
        Returns:
        The block
        Throws:
        PositionOutOfBoundsException - If the position is outside of the bounds of the volume

      • getBlock

        BlockState getBlock(int x,
                    int y,
                    int z)
        Gets a representation of the block at the given position.
        Parameters:
        x - The X position
        y - The Y position
        z - The Z position
        Returns:
        The block
        Throws:
        PositionOutOfBoundsException - If the position is outside of the bounds of the volume

      • getBlockType

        default BlockType getBlockType(com.flowpowered.math.vector.Vector3i position)
        Gets the base type of block.

        The type does not include block data such as the contents of inventories.

        Parameters:
        position - The position of the block
        Returns:
        The type of block
        Throws:
        PositionOutOfBoundsException - If the position is outside of the bounds of the block volume

      • getBlockType

        BlockType getBlockType(int x,
                       int y,
                       int z)
        Gets the base type of block.

        The type does not include block data such as the contents of inventories.

        Parameters:
        x - The X position
        y - The Y position
        z - The Z position
        Returns:
        The type of block
        Throws:
        PositionOutOfBoundsException - If the position is outside of the bounds of the block volume

      • getBlockView

        BlockVolume getBlockView(com.flowpowered.math.vector.Vector3i newMin,
                         com.flowpowered.math.vector.Vector3i newMax)
        Returns a new volume that is the same or smaller than the current volume. This does not copy the blocks, it only provides a new view of the storage.
        Parameters:
        newMin - The new minimum coordinates in this volume
        newMax - The new maximum coordinates in this volume
        Returns:
        The new volume with the new bounds
        Throws:
        PositionOutOfBoundsException - If the new minimum and maximum are outside the current volume

      • getBlockView

        BlockVolume getBlockView(DiscreteTransform3 transform)
        Returns a new volume that is viewed through some transformation. This does not copy the blocks, it only provides a new view of the storage.
        Parameters:
        transform - The transformation to be applied
        Returns:
        The new volume with the transform

      • getRelativeBlockView

        default BlockVolume getRelativeBlockView()
        Returns a new volume that is translated so that getBlockMin() returns Vector3i.ZERO. This does not copy the blocks, it only provides a new view of the storage.
        Returns:
        The new volume with its minimum at zero

      • getUnmodifiableBlockView

        UnmodifiableBlockVolume getUnmodifiableBlockView()
        Returns a new volume that cannot be modified through this view. Unlike immutable storage, it can be changed by holders of mutable views. This does not copy the blocks, it only provides a new view of the storage.
        Returns:
        The new volume, which cannot be modified

      • getBlockCopy

        default MutableBlockVolume getBlockCopy()
        Returns a mutable copy of the blocks stored in this volume. This uses the default storage type of StorageType.STANDARD.
        Returns:
        A copy of the blocks

      • getBlockCopy

        MutableBlockVolume getBlockCopy(StorageType type)
        Returns a mutable copy of the blocks stored in this volume. This uses the provided storage type.
        Parameters:
        type - The type of storage used by the new blocks
        Returns:
        A copy of the blocks

      • getImmutableBlockCopy

        ImmutableBlockVolume getImmutableBlockCopy()
        Returns an immutable copy of the blocks stored in this volume. This uses some internal storage solution that is thread-safe by nature.
        Returns:
        An immutable copy of the blocks

      • getBlockWorker

        BlockVolumeWorker<? extends BlockVolume> getBlockWorker()
        Gets a new block worker for this block volume.
        Returns:
        The block worker
